front.title: The Entity Category SAML Entity Metadata Attribute Type

abstract.t: This document describes a SAML entity attribute which can be used to assign a category semantics to an entity.

note.title: Requirements Language
note.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

section.title: Introduction and Motivation
section.t: This document describes an attribute for use by the EntityAttribute extension to SAML metadata (denoted "entity category attribute" below). The entity category attribute is used to denote the type or category of the SAML entity with wich the attribute is associated.

The category of an entity MAY be used to provision policy for release of attributes from an Identity Provider but other uses is also possible. This document only specifies syntax and semantics for the attribute, it does not specify a controlled vocabulary for the attribute values. It is expected that other specifications will provide management and discovery of the values of the entity category attribute.

section.title: Syntax
section.t: When asserted in SAML metadata the Entity Category attribute MUST be represented using an Attribute element with @NameFormat urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:uri and @Name http://macedir.org/entity-category. The Entity Category attribute MAY contain multiple AttributeValue elements. A single EntityAttributes element MUST NOT contain multiple separate Attribute elements for this attribute type.
